newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: EVC wins order to expand Thai PVC plant.
newsitem.headline: EVC wins order to expand Thai PVC plant.

text.p: Europe's biggest PVC producer EVC International said on Thursday it had won an order to expand a PVC plant of Thai Plastic & Chemicals Public Co Ltd (TPC).

EVC will provide the process technology and Bechtel International Inc of the U.S. will supply engineering, procurement and construction. The expansion of the plant, which is based 180 kilometres south-east of Bangkok, will raise its annual PVC production by 120,000 tonnes to 460,000 tonnes.
EVC, in which Britain's ICI and Italy's Enichem jointly hold a minority stake, gave no financial details of the contract.
Since 1990, EVC's Licensing Business unit has sold 47 licences to 30 companies around the world.
In 1997, the company's licensing activities included the start-up of plants in China, Taiwan, Australia, Saudi Arabia, India, the U.S. and Belgium.
